macroSpec.desc: CMN ornam attribute values: A = appogiatura (upper neighbor); a = acciaccatura (lower neighbor); b = bebung; I = ascending slide; i = descending slide; k = delayed turn; K = 5-note turn; m = mordent (alternation with lower neighbor); M = inverted mordent (alternation with upper neighbor); N = Nachschlag (upper neighbor); n = Nachschlag (lower neighbor); S = turn; s = inverted turn; t = trill commencing on auxiliary note; T = trill commencing on principal note; O = generic / unspecified ornament.

attDef.desc: Records semantic meaning, i.e., intended performance, of the mordent. The altsym, glyph.name, or glyph.num attributes may be used to specify the appropriate symbol.

valItem.desc: Starts with the written note, followed by its lower neighbor, with a return to the written note. In modern practice, this is called an "inverted mordent" and indicated by a short wavy line with a vertical line through it.
Starts with the written note, followed by its upper neighbor, with a return to the principal note. In modern practice, the symbol lacks the vertical line used for the inverted form.

attDef.desc: When set to 'true', a double or long mordent, sometimes called a "pincé double", consisting of 5 notes, is indicated.
Records the written accidental associated with an upper neighboring note.
Records the written accidental associated with a lower neighboring note.

classSpec.desc: Attributes for marking the presence of an ornament.

attDef.desc: Indicates that this element has an attached ornament. If visual information about the ornament is needed, then one of the elements that represents an ornament (mordent, trill, or turn) should be employed.
When set to 'true', the turn begins on the second half of the beat.
Records meaning; i.e., intended performance, of the turn. The altsym, glyph.name, or glyph.num attributes may be used to specify the appropriate symbol.

valItem.desc: Begins on the note below the written note.
Begins on the note above the written note.

elementSpec.desc: An ornament indicating rapid alternation of the main note with a secondary note, usually a step below, but sometimes a step above.

sch:rule.sch:assert: Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.

remarks.p: The starting point of the mordent may be indicated by either a startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges, or tstamp.real attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify one of these attributes.

elementSpec.desc: Rapid alternation of a note with another (usually at the interval of a second above).

sch:rule.sch:assert: Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.

remarks.p: The interval between the main and auxiliary notes is usually understood to be diatonic unless altered by an accidental. The starting note of the trill; i.e., the written one or the ornamenting one, and the speed of alternation depends on performance practice. The starting point of the trill may be indicated by either a startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges, or tstamp.real attribute, while the ending point may be recorded by either a dur, dur.ges, endid, or tstamp2 attribute. It is a semantic error not to specify a starting point attribute.

elementSpec.desc: An ornament consisting of four notes — the upper neighbor of the written note, the written note, the lower neighbor, and the written note.

sch:rule.sch:assert: Must have one of the attributes: startid, tstamp, tstamp.ges or tstamp.real.

remarks.p: See Read, p. 246-247. Whether the turn is accented or unaccented may be inferred from the timestamp — accented turns occur directly on the affected beat, unaccented ones do not.
